page.title: 01AROUND EARDISLEY VILLAGE
page.content: This block is situated around {Eardisley}village in the county of Herefordshire and Worcester.It also covers the hamlets of{Woodseaves {Welson}and{Great Oak}.It is a farming area ,very lush,on a plain overlooked by The Black Mountains and close to the River Wye.'{Herdeslege}' was the old name for Eardisley,which meant'The clearing in the Wood of Eards.'In the {Domesday Book}of 1086 the land was wooded.It had 'one plough,two serfs ,and a Welshman.'There was a wooden { castle},later replaced by a stone one ,to protect the village from Welsh raids.In the hamlet of{Great Oak}is an oak tree said to be over a 1000 years old.It is about 30ft in girth.In the 1930's some children put some dead leaves by the tree,burning a hole in the trunk.It was found to be hollow but still has new growth each year.
